intro: Thesium jarmilae, commonly known as the Jarmilae torchflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Plumbaginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, candle-like inflorescence. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Thesium jarmilae is adapted to the arid and rocky environment of Socotra, showcasing unique morphological features. Its conservation status is vulnerable due to habitat loss and limited distribution.
